data.title: On the occasion of Statehood Day, Siniša Mihajlović, Kornelije Kovač, Lazar Ristovski were honored...
data.meta_description: Minister of Labor and Social Protection in the Government of Azerbaijan, Sahil Babajev, former Belgrade Archbishop Stanislav Hočevar, former US Special Envoy for Dialogue between Belgrade and Pristina, Richard Grenell, recently deceased famous soccer player and coach Siniša Mihajlović, actor Lazar Rustovski, fashion designer Verica Rakočević - they are only some of those honored on the occasion of the Day of Serbian Statehood.
data.text:
A total of 169 decorations were awarded in the Presidency building.

President Aleksandar Vučić said that "this proves that Serbia does not forget friends who have done something for our country and its citizens".

"By accepting it, you have joined the ranks of individuals and institutions without whom Serbia would not be what it is." "You who, on the occasion of the Day of Serbian Statehood, Sretenje, have deserved this brilliant award, know that the eyes of our citizens are on you, as well as their inexhaustible trust in your love and good intentions," said Vučić.

Vučić stated that today Serbia is "pressured from different sides", it must be "on its own", and that it must "protect the country, the people and look to the future".

Who are honored?

The Minister of Labor and Social Protection of the Population of Azerbaijan, Sahil Babajev, the long-time Archbishop of Belgrade Stanislav Hočevar and the former US special envoy for dialogue between Belgrade and Pristina, Richard Grenell, were awarded the Order of the Serbian Flag of the First Class.

Elena Mina was awarded the Order of the Serbian Flag of the third degree for her contribution to the development and strengthening of bilateral relations between Serbia and Cyprus.

The director of the Institute for Cardiovascular Diseases "Dedinje", Milovan Bojić, the library of Matica Srpska for the collection and preservation of the literary fund of historical and cultural importance, "Jugoslovensko rečno brodarstvo ad Beograd" on the occasion of 130 years of successful work were awarded the Order of Merit of the first degree.

The order was also awarded to the Belgrade Philharmonic for merits in public and cultural activities and on the occasion of its 100th anniversary, the Ballet of the National Theater in Belgrade for the achieved results and the "Milovan Milovanović" Institute of War Medicine of the Faculty of Medicine in Belgrade on the occasion of a century of work.

The Order of Happiness, second degree, was presented to actress Radmila Živković, Vukov sabor in Tršić, the National Museum in Niš, the Bor Institute of Mining and Metallurgy and the Faculty of Mechanical Engineering in Belgrade.

The Third Degree Order of Happiness was awarded to the Ethnographic Museum of the National Academy of Sciences of Serbia, the Institute for the Study of Medicinal Plants "Dr Josif Pančić", the Gymnasium "Veljko Petrović" Sombor, the Primary School "Vuk Karadžić" Sočanica, the Primary School "Miladin Mitić" Laplje Selo, the Big Band RTS Jazz Orchestra, Niški symphony orchestra, Belgrade Documentary and Short Film Festival "March Festival", Art Gallery "Nadežda Petrović" Čačak, Film Festival in Sopot, Gymnasium "Žarko Zrenjanin" Vrbas.

Svetlana Stević was also awarded for the results achieved in the field of public and humanitarian activities, Živanka Radovančeva for merits in the field of agriculture, Bora Dimitrijević for merits in the field of public and cultural activities, Slavko Mitrović Cale for merits in the field of music, Association of War Volunteers 1912-1918 , their descendants and admirers for their merits in preserving historical values ​​and nurturing traditions, Puppet Theater "Pinocchio", PTT Museum, Clinic for Digestive Surgery, First Surgery of the University Clinical Center of Serbia.

The Karađorđe star of the first degree was awarded to: actor Lazar Ristovski, member of the Ministry of Defense and the Serbian Army - lieutenant colonel Dejan Stanojević, former football player and coach Siniša Mihajlović and composer Kornelije Kovač.

Jelena Mitrović for strengthening relations between Serbia and the Swiss Confederation in the field of cultural and humanitarian activities, Slobodan Lalić for services in preserving the national identity of Serbia and its citizens in Croatia, Dragan Bošković for services in strengthening relations between Serbia and the USA in the field of of information technologies, Saša Dimitrijević for his merits in developing friendly relations between Serbia and Norway in public activities, especially in the field of journalism.

Ranko Tomović was awarded for his services in developing friendly relations between Serbia and Poland in public and economic activities, Zoran Kalabić for his services in strengthening relations between Serbia and Austria in the field of public and economic activities, and Aleksandar Nikolić for his services in developing friendly relations between Serbia and Israel.

Former policeman Dejan Pantić was awarded the "Miloš Obilić" Golden Medal for Courage, and lieutenant Božidar Žugić was awarded posthumously.

The Golden Medal of Merit was awarded to Chen Danyen for the results achieved in the field of literature and the promotion of Serbia in China, Milan Đurić for his services in developing friendly relations between Serbia and Hungary in public and cultural activities, the Shooting Association of Serbia, the Society of Mathematicians of Serbia, the Fund for Innovation Activities, Mile Poštić for achieved results in the field of musical art, Branimir Đokića for achieved results in the field of operatic art.

This order was also awarded to Željko Lučić for the results achieved in the field of ballet art, Konstantin Eduardović Kostjukov for merits in work, achievements and achievements in the field of economy, Radovan Raičević for merits and results achieved in the field of public activities, Živadin Jovanović for the results achieved in the field of public and humanitarian activities, Mlađen Cicović for merits in the field of fashion design, Verica Rakočević and Bojan Suđić, and posthumously and posthumously Fevzi Šilik for achieved results in economic activities.

The publishing company Pravoslavna reč Novi Sad, Gabrijela Karluči for the results achieved in public activities and Dr. Jakša Vučičević for their services in nurturing and preserving Serbian culture and tradition were awarded the Silver Medal for Merit.

Colonel Dragan Panić, Colonel Žarko Nešić, Colonel Predrag Kraljević, Colonel Slavko Rakić, Lieutenant Colonel Vlada Glišić, Lieutenant Colonel Zoran Stevanović, Major Ivan Radović and Warrant Officer First Class Igor Bubalo were awarded the gold medal for zealous service.
